#1

Welcome to the yearly discussion thread we call "The Republic of Texas." for 2023-2024

The Republic of Texas XLII: "You Don't Just Move Into Texas, It Moves Into You"

Manny Fernandez

This quote is not from a native Texan, but from the talented New York Times Houston Bureau Chief Manny Fernandez.

Mr. Fernandez was born in California, and when asked what he does:

What I Do

"I try to explain Texas to non-Texans."

You don't have to be a Texan to apply to Texas schools. Once you're here, Texas just might move into you, too.

This is a general talk and support thread for Texas school applicants, where we can:

check in with each other

share our news

see where various schools are with their interview process

and just post those things we don't want to put on a school-specific thread.

Go here for the first Texas Roundup posts: Texas Roundup

I'll answer questions here if I know the answers, but keep the technical questions about TMDSAS process over on the thread we have for that:

*~*~*~* Official TMDSAS Questions Thread 2023-2024 *~*~*~*

Last edited: Apr 20, 2024

wysdoc

Plain-spoken Texan

Joined

Jan 21, 2016

Messages

13,463

Reaction score

22,588

Jul 23, 2023

#2

I'll be sharing things with you as I hear them and as our cycle unfolds.

Some of the schools have sent out their first interview invitations in July.

Some schools don't start inviting until late August, so "no news" is not bad news, and there are months of invitations to come.

I'll come back to this thread to edit and add dates of the invites that I hear about, and update as more schools take action.

~*~*~Interview Invitations~*~*~

UT Tyler: July 3, 20, 25, Aug 21, Sept 28, Oct 16, 19, 23, Nov ?, Nov 28, Dec 13//

Texas Tech Lubbock: July 11,17, 20, 21, 26, 27, Aug 4, 14, 20, 22, 31, Sept 1, 6, 7, 8, 16, 19, 25, 26, Oct 4, 7, 16, 18, Nov 8, 10, Dec 5, 29, Jan 4//

UNTHSC (TCOM) (DO): July 28, 31, Aug 2, 16, 31, Sept 11, 14, 20, 29, Oct 3, 11, 12, Nov 7, 13, 22, 26, Dec 8//

Random question but do Texas schools do post-II R before the match, or is it that every school you interview at you're eligible to rank during the match?

Jul 24, 2023

#5

Random question but do Texas schools do post-II R before the match, or is it that every school you interview at you're eligible to rank during the match?

It is pretty uncommon but it has happened.

If a school does happen to reject you after an interview, don't rank them for the match because they won't have you on their possible match list.

#7

Does anyone have a list of TX schools that specifically call for II/acceptances/pre-matches rather than email, or alternatively, do schools who call for II leave voicemails? I work so I can't always pick up the phone and I get a lot of spam calls, so picking up the phone is always a roulette game.

They will always leave a voicemail message if it’s important.

Offers of acceptance pre-match come by email and on Match Day you will see the Match in your TMDSAS portal

The only one that previously liked to call for interview invitations is Dell, (edited to add yes, Dell is still calling for interview invitations)

UTSW does email for II, acceptance, and scholarships. At least, they did for me. Same for Baylor and McGovern.

I don't remember 100%, but I think Dell, UTMB, and Long emailed me for interview as well.

Can anyone else confirm? I was an OOS applicant, so no match for me.

Does anyone know if CASPER scores are required to be received by texas schools in order for them to send you an II or do they allow scores to come in up until the day of the interview?

I cant imagine a school REQUIRING them would invite people without them since many schools need a file to be complete before passing it to reviewers. It is possible to be ignored for highstats or other attractive candidates but wont be a norm.

Just stopping by to say hi, y'all! I'm a former Texan of 7 years and a current OOS applicant hoping to be lassoed back into the state by the good grace of an admissions committee. I'm a little behind on my apps; I submitted 7/1 (the earliest I could) and will likely be waiting 2-3 more weeks before my TMDSAS verification. At that point, I hope to turn around my secondaries pretty quickly and get on the interview train. Good luck everyone!

TCOM has openly reported their number of II to acceptances. Are there any other Texas schools that report this information?

All schools report this information on the MSAR database.

If you don't have a subscription to it, getting one is the best $28.00 you will spend all year.

It's useful for a lot of reasons, and posting its info widely isn't allowed under the terms of the subscription.

All schools report this information on the MSAR database.

If you don't have a subscription to it, getting one is the best $28.00 you will spend all year.

It's useful for a lot of reasons, and posting its info widely isn't allowed under the terms of the subscription.

MSAR unfortunately just has II-to-matriculation, not the total number of acceptances. What I've seen is that for most schools, a rule of thumb is you can multiply the number of matriculants by 1.5 to 2x to get the number of acceptances, though at some schools that number is closer to 3x. (Let me know if I'm wrong there)

@purkinjekitty

There's also this helpful spreadsheet, which is from a few years ago, so it is a little outdated but is still the best source of information I've found about this. It's based on USNWR data

#34

How often do these two schools offer II’s this early to applicants in the LM low 70’s? I know they are both very high stat so I didn’t know how that played in this early.

Dont know about Long but UTSW follows group 1 and group 2 policies where their initial IIs always go to high stat students. There may be some exceptions to this where they look at institutional needs like low income first gen/URM that are exceptions.

In the past they had no reviews for high stat IS apps classified as group 1 but lately they added that step and some considered high stat dont even get called.

Be sure you have done everything you need to be complete, including doing the CASPer test, and settle in for this long period of waiting.

#44

Even with the match moving from March to February?

The match was always in February until they switched to March in 2021.

Personally, I applaud the decision to put it in February again because the last couple of cycles people were simultaneously on WLs and submitting their reapplications in May.

I hope there will be less overlap in cycles this way.

Last edited: Aug 6, 2023

#46

So I know Dell and Long both say they do continuous app review where they might look at your app a 2nd time later in the cycle, but do all the Texas schools do that? Or are they just looked at once?

I will not pretend to know what goes on behind the curtain of the great Wizard of OZ.

(do people your age still watch that? LOL)

There are lots of ways they can go about reviewing thousands of applications, but my estimation would be that they get reviewed more than once. The review process is not uniform across schools.

There are lots of ways they can go about reviewing thousands of applications, but my estimation would be that they get reviewed more than once. The review process is not uniform across schools.

Agree. I am certain there are some apps being filtered out based on credentials. Very hard for Baylor to pick someone with a 3.5/500 as an example but it doesn't stop people from applying since it is a single TMDSAS app. UH wont pick someone with 4.0/525 interested in research since they are not offering that in their mission statement.

If your overall app meets the goal of the school, you are in contention until they run out of slots for interviews. The real issue is that they have only so many interview slots and there can be 2-3 times the people who can be in the ballpark of the interview even if they have 8-10 times the applicants.
